document_data.caption: Glue (left) and pitch (right) were often made from resins.
document_data.name: Resin
document_data.mainbody: '''Resin''' was a broad class of substances produced from the sap of plants and some animals, and used for a wide array of purposes. Depending on the type, it could also be known as '''gum'''.
document_data.Availability: [[Aurora's Emporium]] sold a variety of high-quality gums and resins at reasonable prices, suited for the rituals and practices of [[priest]]s, the arcane experimentation of [[wizard]]s, as well as more common variants suited for everyday use.
document_data.Usages: Resins were widely used in the production of food, [[perfume]], [[candy]], [[adhesive]]s, and [[alchemical]] recipes. They were also used in medicine for their curative properties. Certain resins could also be used in the construction of furniture and buildings as [[glue]] and as [[varnish]].{{Cite dragon/13/How Heavy Is My Giant|7}}{{Cite dragon/81/Living in a material world|62,64}}
document_data.Varieties:
[[File:Spruce Resin.png|thumb|''[[Spruce]] tree resin.'']]
Resins were produced by a wide variety of plants. More valuable examples included:
* [[Asafetida]] (gum asafetida)
* [[Benzoin]] (gum benzoin)
* [[Camphor]] (gum camphor), from the [[camphor tree]].
* [[Cassia]], from the [[cassia tree]].
* [[Dragons' blood]], from the [[dragons' blood tree]].
* [[Elemi]]
* [[Galbanum]]
* [[Gum arabic]], from the [[acacia]] tree.
* [[Frankincense]], from the [[frankincense tree]].
* [[Lacquer]], from the [[lacquer tree]]. 
* [[Myrrh]], from the [[myrrh tree]].
* [[Onycha]]
* Talsh, from [[nychaki]].
* [[Storax]]

[[File:Lakh Resin.png|thumb|''lakh insect resin.'']]
A few varieties of valuable resins came from animals, including:
* [[Ambergris]], from [[whale]]s.
* [[Lakh resin]], from the [[lakh]] insect.
* [[Propolis]], from [[bee]] [[honeycomb]].

Resins could also be changed into substances far-removed from their original forms, such as:
* [[Amber]], a solidified golden-orange resin valued as a [[gem]].
* [[Pitch]], a refined resin used for construction.
* [[Terebinth]], a distilled resin used in alchemy.
* [[Ostorian resin]], a resin of unidentified ancient design.
